Analysis of temperature differences between regions in
South Korea using functional data analysis
Received 12 October 2023, revised 10 November 2023, accepted 18 November 2023
The distribution of land temperature of South Korea exhibits characteristic diver-
sity due to the pattern of global climate change. There has not been any statistical
research on how the regional temperature differences are changing and whether they
are decreasing or not. This paper conducts an analysis of temperature differences be-
tween regions in South Korea from 1981 to 2022 using functional data analysis (FDA).
In specific, we applied functional principal component analysis (FPCA) and functional
analysis of variance (FANOVA) using Korean weather data to examine how the tem-
perature differences among South Korean regions have changed from the past to the
present. As a result, the statistical analysis shows that the temperature difference
among South Korea has been decreased gradually.
Keywords: Functional data analysis, functional principal component analysis, func-
